title: Concerns raised over TRAI’s call drop compensation rules
text: Concerns raised over TRAI’s call drop compensation rules Sunday, 18 October 2015 (20 minutes ago) Experts have raised concerns over the implementation of telecom regulator TRAI‘s new rules regarding the compensation to consumers for call drops. Under the rule, mobile users will get a compensation of Re 1 for every dropped call from January 1 but it will be limited to a maximum three dropped calls in a day. However, the compensation will be given only if the call drop takes place due to the calling party’s network and not because of the receiving operator’s network.
